page.title: 07THE TELEPHONE EXCHANGE
page.content: On Tuesday 8th May our Headmaster took us to the local Telephone Exchange. It is a fairly new building about 100 metres from the school - it was built in 1975. We were met by Mr. Richards who was in sole charge of the building. He also looks after four other exchanges in the area. What impressed me most was the computer which controlled the timing of all the calls and stored all the information about the Bank Holidays and weekends, when the calls are cheaper. It was amazing how it worked -all the information was fed into it at the beginning of the year and the it kept a complete check on all the pricing of calls for the year.The exchange serves a vast area from Cwmduad to Rhydlewis and all the surrounding villages. It was a most enjoyable and educational visit.{GAVIN
